meanings.definition: To make more reservations or appointments than there are available spaces or resources.
meanings.sent1: The airline decided to overbook the flight to ensure all seats were filled.
meanings.sent2: It is not a good idea to overbook a restaurant on a busy night.
meanings.sent3: The hotel manager accidentally overbooked the conference room, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm to overbook her schedule led to exhaustion by the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overbooking can result in disappointed customers and lost business opportunities.

meanings.definition: To schedule more tasks or activities than can realistically be completed.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overbook my weekends with social events and errands.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overbook your workday to avoid feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent3: She always manages to overbook her to-do list, thinking she can do it all.
meanings.sent4: Overbooking your day is like trying to fit a puzzle piece into the wrong spot.
meanings.sent5: The habit of overbooking often leads to stress and unfinished tasks.
